(Simplified: 峦)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 䜌 indicates the sound; 山 (mountain) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 䜌 [ luán ] chaos, distraction; to manage, to tie together
    • 山 [ shān ] mountain, hill, peak
①小而尖的山：崗巒。峯巒。
②連着的山：山巒起伏。
(Simplified: 峦)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 䜌 indicates the sound; 山 (mountain) conveys the meaning.
Hanzi: 峦

Related Character(s): 絲, 山, 䜌
Связанный символ (и): шелк, гора, 䜌

Traditional in your browser 繁体字的浏览器显示:巒

Traditional in Unicode standard 繁体字的Unicode标准:U+5DD2

Older traditional characters 旧繁体字/异体字: Not exist

Simplified in your browser 简体字的浏览器显示:峦

Simplified in Unicode standard 简体字的Unicode标准:U+5CE6

Main pronunciation 主要发音: luán

Other pronunciations 其它发音: Not exists.

Original meaning 本义: Meaning mountain range.

English senses 英语理解: mountain range; pointed mountain

Usage example 用法举例: 山巒 shān luán (mountain range)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 3191

Shuowen 说文解字: 山小而銳從山聲

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Compound 巒 from mountain 山 shān and phonetic chaos (亦)䜌 luán.

巒字的基本解释

巒
luán
见“峦”。

巒字的汉语字典释义

[①]［luán］
［《廣韻》落官切，平桓，來。］
“峦1”的繁体字。
(1)小而尖锐的山。
(2)狭长的山。
(3)山脊。
(4)顶端圆形的山。
(5)泛指山。
(6)见“巒岏”。

巒字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【山字部】　巒； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页322第43
【唐韻】落官切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】盧官切，?音鑾。【說文】山小而銳。【六書故】圜峰也。【楚辭·九章】登石巒以遠望兮。　又山紆回綿連曰巒。【徐悱登琅邪城詩】襟帶盡巖巒。　【正字通】又鹽韻，音廉。引蘇軾謝歐陽晦夫遺琴枕詩：我懷汝隂六一老，眉宇秀發如春巒。○按蘇軾俱入寒韻引用，譌。

巒字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

Mountain range
luán

Mountain range
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［luán］
["Guang Yun" cut off the official, Ping Huan, come. ]
The traditional characters of "Luan 1".
(1) Small and sharp mountains.
(2) Long and narrow mountains.
(3) Ridges.
(4) A mountain with a round top.
(5) Refers to mountains in general.
(6) See "Luan岏".
Mountain range
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Collection] [Mountain Character Department] 　 Luan; Kangxi Strokes: 22; Page Number: Page 322 Page 43
[Tang Yun] Laoguan cut [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zhengyun] Lu Guan cut,? Yinluan. [Said the text] The mountain is small and sharp. 【Six Books】Yuanfeng also. [Songs of the Chu Nine Chapters] Climbing Shiluan and looking far away.　The mountains and the mountains continue to stretch back and forth, called the ridges. [Xu Teng Deng Langxie City Poem] The belt is full of rocks.　【Zhengzitong】It has salty rhyme and low sound. Quoting Su Shi's thanks to Ouyang Huifu's left piano pillow poem: I am pregnant with Ruyin Liuyi, my eyebrows and hair are like spring mountains. ○According to Su Shi Ju into Han Yun quoted, Jia.
